comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: The Russian Imperial Yacht Standart (Штандартъ), serving Emperor Nicholas II and his family, was at her time (late 19th/early 20th century) the largest Imperial Yacht afloat. [she] was built by order of Emperor Alexander III of Russia, and constructed at the Danish shipyard of Burmeister & Wain, beginning in 1893. She was launched on 21 March 1895 and came into service early September 1896.

comment.author: 61415649@N04
comment._content: this is one of the largest steam yachts ever built for the Romanov's! mrdot.

comment.author: 99444764@N05
comment._content:
This picture is, despite the text in the center header, not depicting the Russian Imperial Yacht Standart. The picture shows us the Russian Imperial Yacht Polyarnaya Zvezda (Polar Star), being in use by Dowager Empress Marie (wife to Emperor Alexander III).

Harald Hendriksen

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thank you for your comment htrhendriksen. It's very hard to tell the difference between the two ships. But in the images I saw, it looked as though the Polar Star had two levels of "portholes," as may be seen in this photo. In the images I saw of the Standart, there appeared to be only one level.  Would you agree with that? Are there other differences?
